body: Japan in winter really has this surreal beauty. The cold, the fog, and the stillness make everything feel dreamlike. It’s hard to describe, but it’s unforgettable.
That’s such a hauntingly beautiful experience. I can imagine how surreal it must have been to see a place like that, seemingly frozen in time, with only the fog to witness it.
The way you describe Japan in winter makes me want to book a ticket right now. That mix of beauty and emptiness sounds so captivating. I love when the environment feels like it holds secrets.
